author: Laura Hill
title: Newcastle MP Chi Onwurah backs calls for second EU referendum over Brexit 'shambles'
text:
Newcastle MP Chi Onwurah backs calls for second EU referendum over Brexit 'shambles' 14:57, 24 Aug 2016 Ms Onwurah backed calls made by Labour leadership contender Owen Smith, who said he would 'fight tooth and nail' to stay in the EU Shares Get daily news by email Chi Onwurah 
Newcastle MP Chi Onwurah has backed Labour leadership candidate Owen Smith’s pledge to try and block Brexit without a second referendum. 
Mr Smith said he would “fight tooth and nail” to keep the UK in the EU and said that, under his leadership, Labour would oppose the triggering of Article 50 - the formal way to leave the EU - in a future Commons vote unless certain conditions were met. 
He said: “Theresa May says that ‘Brexit means Brexit’ - but nobody knows what Brexit looks like.” 
Mr Smith, Pontypridd MP, added that British people were “lied to” by those campaigning to leave the EU and they deserve to have a say on the terms of the exit. 
He told BBC Radio 5 live: “It would be irresponsible of Theresa May to simply trigger Article 50 and sleepwalk out... Labour still believes that we should be a part of the European Union .” 
And Ms Onwurah, Labour MP for Newcastle Central, echoed those claims - saying Brexit has become a “shambles” since 52.5% of people voted to leave the EU in June. Labour leadership candidate Owen Smith. Photo by Ben Birchall/PA Wire 
She said: “There is really strong agreement that the British people should have the chance to vote on what this shambles will actually look like. 
“Lots of the reasons why people voted for Brexit have been ignored, lots of my constituents have expressed disappointment and disillusion that what was promised on the NHS , immigration and jobs haven’t materialised.” 
Ms Onwurah added: “I think there is a strong argument for having another vote. 
“If the Government manages to deliver a Brexit which meets the expectations that would be one thing but looking at the shambles that we have that seems increasingly unlikely and British people deserve a vote.” 
Pro-Brexit Northumberland MP, Anne-Marie Trevelyan, said that the Tories will exit Europe whenever Britain is ready, but there should be no second vote. Stefan Rousseau/PA Wire EU and UK flags fly above the EU Commission offices in Westminster 
She said: “We will trigger Article 50 when we are ready and not before. We have over 40 years of EU regulation and laws to extricate ourselves from, and new trade deals to strike with the world’s major economies who are queuing up to make deals.” 
The MP for Berwick added that the mandate of the Brexit vote cannot be ignored, after more than 30m people turned out to vote - more than in last year’s general election. 
She said: “The Prime Minister has been very clear that there will not be a second referendum. The turnout for the referendum extremely very high, and more people voted in it than have ever voted for anything before.” 
And Ms Trevelyan took a swipe at the opposition party, as ballot papers for the second leadership election in two years are sent out. 
She said: “Whilst the Labour party continues to tear itself apart with its ongoing leadership election, the Conservatives are getting on with running the country and ensuring that we follow through with the nation’s decision and making a success of the fantastic new opportunities it presents.” Poll loading …
